news_header: A SpaceX Dragon capsule has docked at the ISS to bring back two astronauts who were stranded due to a flight fault.
news_text: The SpaceX Dragon capsule successfully docked at the International Space Station (ISS) to retrieve astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who were stranded beyond their planned eight-day stay due to a flight issue. They are now expected to return to Earth in February. The capsule launched from Cape Canaveral, Florida, carrying NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Russian cosmonaut Alexander Gorbunov. Meanwhile, various other news events include a medical emergency during transport, political campaign activities, and significant weather events affecting communities.
